sentences.english: In the car accident he lost feeling below the waist.
sentences.chinese: 这次车祸使他腰部底下全无知觉。

sentences.english: It is useless attacking the insensible.
sentences.chinese: 攻击无知觉的东西是徒劳的。

sentences.english: She looked back at Kelly's unconscious form.
sentences.chinese: 她回头看了看凯丽无知觉的状态。

sentences.english: A person may become unconscious, not knowing what is happening.
sentences.chinese: 此时人会变得神志不清，对周围发生的事情毫无知觉。

sentences.english: Let him put handcuffs on the dead and beat them senseless with whips.
sentences.chinese: 让他铐上死人的手吧，鞭打他们无知觉的尸体吧。

sentences.english: She fell, motionless, onto the road.
sentences.chinese: 毫无知觉地，她倒在了路上。

sentences.english: As to his head, he was conscious of nothing but a feeling of fulness - of congestion.
sentences.chinese: 他的头毫无知觉但是却似乎充血肿胀。

sentences.english: Absorbed in her work, she was totally oblivious of her surroundings.
sentences.chinese: 她专心于工作，对周围的一切毫无知觉。

sentences.english: Sir Henry lay unconscious where he had fallen.
sentences.chinese: 亨利爵士躺在他摔倒的地方，毫无知觉。

sentences.english: Picture my body lying on the ground unconscious.
sentences.chinese: 想像我的身体无知觉地躺在地上。

sentences.english: And no loss of consciousness for more than five seconds.
sentences.chinese: 未出现超过5秒钟无知觉的现象。

definition: to be delirious/to be mentally confused
to lose consciousness/to be in a coma/stupor/coma/stunned/disoriented
